Posted By: Snaxme (12/12/2009 2:56:43 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think the fastest this thing can grow is (say you aren't going first, so you draw):  
Turn 1: Forest, Treefolk Harbinger  
Turn 2: Forest, Bosk Banneret  
Turn 3: Forest, Bosk Banneret, Bosk Banneret, Dauntless Dourbark (it's an 8/8)  
Turn 4: Forest, Timber Protector, Timber Protector (Dauntless is an 13/13 trample indestructible! It's more than a Darksteel Colossus!), let the smackdown begin!  
  
Also, Murmuring Bosk is a Forest for a reason...it counts towards the Dourbark! (and then is indestructible from Timber Protectors)
posts.html:

Posted By: Kryptnyt (12/29/2011 1:53:52 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Hate Dauntless Dourbark so much. In a mono green treefolk deck, or even a Doran treefolk deck using nonbasic forests like Murmuring Bosk for mana, he gets so insanely big for 4 mana, and virtually always has trample. Then you throw in that his lord makes him indestructible. Seems like a fair card. >.>  
  
Throw in that most treefolk have large rear ends so that one of the only ways to effectively deal with them is to either have lots of destroy creature spells, or just enough exile spells to get rid of key treefolk even through the Timber Protector. But yeah, they're annoying as heck.
posts.html:

Then you throw in that his lord makes him indestructible. Seems like a fair card. >.>

Throw in that most treefolk have large rear ends so that one of the only ways to effectively deal with them is to either have lots of destroy creature spells, or just enough exile spells to get rid of key treefolk even through the Timber Protector. But yeah, they're annoying as heck.
